title: Business & Finance
text:
Goldman posted records in quarterly revenue and profit, while JPMorgan notched its highest quarterly profit on record. Wells Fargo enjoyed its best-ever quarterly profit in corporate and investment banking.

---

Dell said it would spin off its stake valued at $52 billion in cloud-software company VMware, a deal the PC maker said would strengthen its financial position.

---

American Airlines said it is preparing to operate a nearly normal summer schedule, anticipating that widespread vaccination will unleash appetite for travel.

The Justice Department has stepped up an antitrust probe of American's recent partnership with JetBlue .

---

Thermo Fisher is nearing a deal to buy pharmaceutical-testing company PPD for more than $15 billion.

---

The S&P 500 and Nasdaq fell 0.4% and 1%, respectively, while the Dow industrials posted a 0.2% gain.

---

Luxury-goods retailer LVMH reported a strong rebound in first-quarter sales, defying the pandemic's drag on the global economy.

---

Kohl's reached a deal with activist investors that will add three directors to its board and leave its CEO atop the department-store chain.
